content.html:
Sensitivity


Adjust the camera's sensitivity to light.

OptionDescription
AUT01 AUTO2 AUTO3Sensitivity is automatically adjusted in response to shoot- ing conditions according to combination of standard and maximum sensitivity and minimum shutter speed cho- sen for � SHOOTING SETTING > ISO. Choose from AUTO1, AUTO2, and AUTO3 ( ≡ 107).
80-12800Adjust sensitivity manually. Selected value is shown in dis- play.
L (40) H (25600/51200/102400)Choose for special situations. Note that mottling may ap- pear in pictures taken at H, while L reduces dynamic range.
Sensitivity settings can be displayed by pressing the Fn button to
which sensitivity is assigned.
5

Sensitivity is not reset when the camera is turned off.
● If desired, you can use a BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND
DIAL SETTING to configure the camera SO that ISO sensitivity can be
adjusted using the front or rear command dial.

Adjusting Sensitivity


Taking
Photographs

High values can be used to reduce blur when lighting is poor, while lower
values allow slower shutter speeds or wider apertures in bright light; note,
however, that mottling may appear in pictures taken at high sensitivities.

106
content.markdown:
# Sensitivity

# Adjust the camera's sensitivity to light.

Sensitivity settings can be displayed by pressing the Fn button to
which sensitivity is assigned.

| Option | Description |
| --- | --- |
| AUT01 AUTO2 AUTO3 | Sensitivity is automatically adjusted in response to shoot- ing conditions according to combination of standard and maximum sensitivity and minimum shutter speed cho- sen for � SHOOTING SETTING > ISO. Choose from AUTO1, AUTO2, and AUTO3 ( ≡ 107). |
| 80-12800 | Adjust sensitivity manually. Selected value is shown in dis- play. |
| L (40) H (25600/51200/102400) | Choose for special situations. Note that mottling may ap- pear in pictures taken at H, while L reduces dynamic range. |


5

- Sensitivity is not reset when the camera is turned off.
- ● If desired, you can use a BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND
- DIAL SETTING to configure the camera SO that ISO sensitivity can be
- adjusted using the front or rear command dial.


Adjusting Sensitivity

Taking
Photographs

High values can be used to reduce blur when lighting is poor, while lower
values allow slower shutter speeds or wider apertures in bright light; note,
however, that mottling may appear in pictures taken at high sensitivities.

106
